abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Third Education Project in Oman. The
            project objectives included: (i) the development of key
            services (management, planning and curriculum development)
            in the Ministry of Education (MOE), which was later expanded
            to include expert assistance and fellowship training for
            education planning and the production of educational
            Television (TV); (ii) the training and upgrading of
            teachers; and (iii) increased access to education,
            particularly for girls and children of the poor in rural
            areas. Bank's performance was highly satisfactory.
            Borrower's performance was highly satisfactory. The key
            lessons learned were as follows: (a) local capacity to
            adequately select, manage and monitor experts who implement
            Technical Assistance (TA) programs was overestimated; (b)
            responsibility for implementation should be lodged in a
            single unit within the MOE. This was not the case in this
            project resulting in weak coordination and monitoring of TA;
            and (c) the TA recipient must ensure that there is adequate
            reporting by the TA provider who is held accountable for
            delivering the product according to firm schedules.

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Third Education
            Project are to develop and modernize the education system in
            Oman so that Omanis are better prepared for modern sector
            employment. In support of this objective, the Ministry of
            Education and Youth's (MOEY) ability to plan and
            efficiently manage a rapidly expanding school system will
            have to be improved. This will be accomplished by developing
            such key education services in MOEY as planning, management
            and curriculum development. Attention will also focus on
            training and upgrading teacher qualifications, and improving
            access to education for children in rural areas,
            particularly girls. These mentioned objectives will be
            addressed by: 1) establishing technical assistance support;
            2) constructing and equipping three teacher training
            colleges; and, 3) supporting the construction of 30 primary
            schools and 5 secondary schools.
